question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
How many triangles can be formed using the vertices of a regular dodecagon (a 12-sided polygon)?
inference:
The number of triangles that can be formed using the vertices of a regular dodecagon is given by the formula:

$$T = \frac{n(n-1)(n-2)}{6}$$

where n is the number of sides of the polygon.

In this case, n = 12, so:

$$T = \frac{12(12-1)(12-2)}{6}$$

$$T = \frac{12(11)(10)}{6}$$

$$T = 220$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$220$}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: No three vertices are collinear, so any combination of 3 vertices will make a triangle. Choosing 3 out of 12 is $\binom{12}{3}=\boxed{220}.$
